court : seattle police ok to stun pregnant womanby gene johnson associate press writerseattle - - three seattle police officer be justify when they use a stun gun on a pregnant mother who refuse to sign a traffic ticket , a federal appeal court rule friday in a case that prompt an incredulous dissent . malaika brook be drive her son to seattle ' s african american academy in 2004 when she be stop for do 32 mph in a school zone . she insist it be the car in front of her that be speed , and refuse to sign the ticket because she think she ' d be admit guilt . rather than give her the ticket and let her go on her way , the officer decide to arrest her . one reach in , turn off her car and drop the key on the floor . brook stiffen her arm against the steering wheel and tell the officer she be pregnant , but refuse to get out , even after they threaten to stun her . the officer - sgt . steven daman , officer juan ornelas and officer donald jones - then stun her three time , in the thigh , shoulder and neck , and haul her out of the car , lay her face - down in the street . brook give birth to a healthy baby two month later , but have permanent scar from the taser . she sue the officer for violate her constitutional right , and u.s. district judge richard jones allow the case to continue . he decline to grant the officer immunity for perform their official duty and say brook ' right be clearly violate . but in a 2 - 1 ruling friday , a panel of the 9 th u.s. circuit court of appeal disagree . judge cynthia holcomb hall and diarmuid f . o ' scannlain hold that the officer be justify in make an arrest because brook be obstruct them and resist arrest . the use of force be also justified because of the threat brook pose , hall write : `` it seem clear that brook be not go to be able to harm anyone with her car at a moment ' s notice . nonetheless , some threat she might retrieve the key and drive off erratically remain , particularly give her refusal to leave the car and her state of agitation . `` they also note that the force use wasn ' t that serious because the taser be in `` touch `` mode rather than `` dart `` mode , which hurt more . they reverse the low court ' s opinion and hold that the officer be entitle to immunity from the lawsuit . the officer ' lawyer , ted buck and karen cobb , say the officer make the right decision under the circumstance they face . `` police officer have to have the ability to compel people to obey their lawful order , `` buck say . that ' s all the court recognize today . the 9 th circuit just apply the law instead of get catch up in the otherwise unfortunate factual circumstance . `` the majority ' s opinion outrage judge marsha berzon , who call it `` off the wall . `` `` i fail utterly to comprehend how my colleague be able to conclude that it be objectively reasonable to use any force against brook , let alone three activation of a taser , in response to such a trivial offense , `` she write . she argue that under washington law , the officer have no authority to take brook into custody : failure to sign a traffic infraction be not an arrestable offense , and it ' s not illegal to resist an unlawful arrest . berzon say the majority ' s notion that brook obstructed officer be so far - fetch that even the officer themselves do not make that legal argument . to obstruct an officer , one must obstruct the officer ' s official duty , and the officer ' only duty in this case be to detain brook long enough to identify her , check for warrant , write up the citation and give it to her . brook ' failure to sign do not interfere with those duty , she say . furthermore , brook pose no apparent threat , and the officer could not have know how stunning her would affect the fetus , or whether it might prompt premature labor - another reason their action be inexcusable , berzon say . brook ' lawyer , eric zubel , say he would ask the 9 th circuit to rehear the case . `` this be outrageous - that something like this could happen to a pregnant woman , in front of an elementary school , at 8:30 in the morning , to someone who pose no threat whatsoever , `` he say . for anti - choicers , it ' s just about control and power over woman . they do not care about life . ( except their own . ) this same mother could be a person who do not have access to pre - natal care . they would not defend that right either . because they don ' t care about the fetus . they do not care about life . they do not care about health . they care about power and money and push people around . that ' s all .
